subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit bug for XML testing?
msgSnippet: ... Thanks for pointing those out, Scott.  You also posted an answer on the topic of swingui & jdk 1.4 that has an excellent summary of why the LinkageError
messageBody:
Scott Stirling wrote:

>>We're working on making the FAQ better. The fact
>>that I'm digging through the archives for these
>>nuggets says something.
>>
>
>If it helps, here are a couple answers I tried to answer pretty
>definitively (explaining exactly why and how to work around . . .). It
>would be an honor to have them added to the FAQ:
>
>Q: Why a ClassCastException when you narrow() in an EJB client TestCase?
>A: Date: Mon Jul 16, 2001 5:11 pm
> Subject: RE: [junit] ClassCastException only using swing/awt ui
>
>
>Q: Why do I get a LinkageError when using XML interfaces in my TestCase?
>A: Date: Tue Jul 10, 2001 11:32 pm
> Subject: RE: [junit] Class loader error with junit
>

Thanks for pointing those out, Scott. You also posted an answer on the
topic of "swingui & jdk 1.4" that has an excellent summary of why the
LinkageError may occur. I have all these queued up for the FAQ, and it
will be my honor to add them. ;-)

By the way, contributions to the FAQ always include proper recognition
of the person who volunteered the answer. In the case of multiple
answers, I have the often times difficult task of picking the one that I
feel FAQ readers will best understand.

Mike

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.
